intro: Lasiandra elegans, commonly known as the elegant lasiandra, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub with finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to yellowish flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance and pleasant scent.
